title: Monetize unused storage space.
subtitle: A simple peer-to-peer application that enables storage providers to monetize unused storage by hosting encrypted shards of data.

title: Reclaming our privacy & security
subtitle: Hosts monotize their unused hard-drive space which allows storing of users encrypted data.
subtitle2: Hosts get paid in our Cryptocurrency, Inxt. The more space allocated to the network equals to more Inxt earned.

title: Everything has been done for you
subtitle: Simply download the desktop application, create your node, and your device will automatically be connected.
subtitle3: Set-up is simple and easy. Enter your ERC20 address, select where you want to store data and then choose how much storage you want to allocate.
subtitle4: The homescreen displays only your necessary information, so you can get started as quickly as possible without having to learn anything new.

subtitle: More storage you host, more Inxt you own, calculates to a greater income.

title: Get started on Internxt Core
subtitle: Every month, we will send you a payout based on how much space you allocated and how much Inxt you held. The more time you run the node, the more likely the network will allocate your node, and it will rank you as high quality node. Set-up is quick and easy, just download the app and follow the steps.
subtitle2: Enter your Inxt Wallet address, choose where you’d like to store data, allocate your desired storage capacity and finally, insert your public IP.
subtitle3: If your IP is dynamic (one that periodically changes), you can use no IP and enter your hostname instead. Click here to find out whether your public IP is static or dynamic.
subtitle4: All communication will go through a port in your router that you need to open. We suggest which port you need to open on the Core application.
subtitle5: If you want to choose your own port, when entering your public IP address in Step 2, you can write it in the format IP:Port (eg 64.23.35.49:4243).  To open your port, access http://192.168.1.1/ with your browser.
subtitle6: In your router configuration enter the port range you want to open. When entering the port number, you will need to enter your IP. Enter “ipconfig /all” in your Windows terminal. For Linux and Mac, enter “ifconfig” instead. For a quick 4-minute video tutorial on how to open a port in your router, you can click here. You can also click here to check whether your port was opened correctly.

rows.title: Can anyone run a Internxt Core node?
rows.content: Totally! Anyone can run an Internxt Core node. All you need is a machine with enough available storage space (eg your laptop). Joining Internxt Core is quick and easy!

rows.title: What operating systems are compatible?
rows.content: You can run Internxt Core on Linux, Windows and MacOS.

rows.title: What’s the minimum amount of space needed to get paid?
rows.content: The minimum monthly payout is of €5, which corresponds to 500 GB of hosted data. However, you can boost your payout by holding Internxt tokens. Check out our payout calculator in the Internxt Core page.

rows.title: How much data can I expect my node to store?
rows.content: If you run a node almost uninterruptedly, you should be able to hit the minimum payout in just around a month of running Internxt Core. Once that threshold is reached, you will have already secured a recurring, increasing monthly passive income! There is no real limit on how much you can host and therefore earn by running Internxt Core.

rows.title: How is my node selected to receive data?
rows.content: We want Internxt Drive data to be held by the best performing nodes, so that we can provide a top-notch service to our customers. Nodes are mainly selected based on their available space and uptime.

rows.title: How often will I get paid?
rows.content: Internxt Core payouts are usually sent during the first week of each new month.
